result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Towano Chantell McCastle

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Towano Chantell McCastle not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Towano Chantell McCastle.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 11-22-2022 and all responses to be filed by 12-20-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Towano Chantell McCastle not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Towano Chantell McCastle.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Towano Chantell McCastle not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court status conference.  Defense counsel is in trial on another matter in Branch 46.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Towano Chantell McCastle in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Towano Chantell McCastle in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Towano Chantell McCastle not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Cerniglia does not appear. Due to the lateness of the hour and non appearance of defense counsel, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Towano Chantell McCastle not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Walmart
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Towano Chantell McCastle in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Towano Chantell McCastle in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Towano Chantell McCastle appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 3 and 4.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
